meta_description: The Hunter Museum of American Art includes 100 years of architectures and the most complete collection of American art in the Southeast.
hours_text:
Jump to information

Address & HoursParkingAdmissionsKnow Before You GoToursAccessibilityFamiliesFAQs

## Address & Hours

The Hunter is located in the heart of Chattanooga's downtown arts district and is open to the public 6 days a week. In addition to Tuesdays, the museum is closed Thanksgiving Day, Christmas Eve, Christmas Day, and New Year's Day.

Hours

Monday:

10am - 5pm

Closed

Tuesday:

\- 

Closed

Wednesday:

10am - 5pm

Closed

Thursday:

10am - 8pm

Closed

Friday:

10am - 5pm

Closed

Saturday:

10am - 5pm

Closed

Sunday:

12pm - 5pm

Closed

ADDRESS  

10 Bluff View Ave Chattanooga, TN 37403

Get your directions now!

[View on map](https://www.google.com/maps/dir//10+Bluff+View+Ave,+Chattanooga,+TN+37403/data=!4m6!4m5!1m1!4e2!1m2!1m1!1s0x88605e67020184b5:0xca45c881a3c39497?sa=X&ved=1t:707&ictx=111)

## Parking

Parking is available at the Hunter Museum parking lot, 500 feet from the entrance to the museum. The parking lot is wheelchair accessible. Museum guests can park for free by registering their vehicle using their license plate number once they have entered the museum.

Museum Parking

Hunter Parking Deck

10 Bluff View Ave  
Chattanooga, TN 37403

Additional Parking Options

Bluff View Arts District Street Parking

411 E 2nd St, Chattanooga, TN 37403

Paid Parking

Walnut and 3rd Street

## Admissions

Museum members visit free, no reservation needed. Groups of 10 or more are required to pre-book a tour. Book tickets online or at the museum.
